item.title: Rough pavement with deep dips and trip hazards, 2nd September
item.description:
I am blind and try to navigate this pavement often. I have frequently tripped and stumbled on this pavement. It has caused me to twist my ankle on numerous occasions

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewes Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Abandoned Car. Causing Traffic to Go onto the Other Side of the Road, Nearly Causing an Accident., 2nd September
item.description:
This Car has been Abandoned for Several Months Now, & there is Another Car Opposite, also Abandoned, outside, on the Highway by Patricia Court. Both Need Removal before we have a Bad Accident in Wickham Lane. If & When we Do, it will be Because of the Don't Care, Laid Back Attitude of the Royal Borough of Greenwich
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish under recycling bins, 2nd September
item.description:
Saw a rat under these bins today - not surprising given that there are loads of food recyclables underneath. Please clean it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 332, Hornsey Road, Holloway, London

item.title: Toulet and builder debris left on road, 2nd September
item.description:
The building works at this location has been going on since last October. A toilet is constantly left on the highway as well as varying amounts of builder’s rubble and rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Field Close, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on wall opposite Osborne Pharmacy, 2nd September
item.description:
Someone has scrawled "England" and a cross in brown paint on the wall of a residential propert opposite the Osborne Pharmacy also very close to a hotel housing women and children refugees as part of ongoing campaign to intimidate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Sandway Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: During the night of 31 August/1 September a double mattress was fly-tipped in front of No 44 Little Bornes, SE21., 2nd September
item.description:
The dumped mattress was found partly on the road and partly on the pavement. As it was causing an obstruction it has been moved and stacked against the side garden wall of No 41 Little Bornes. Please arrange for collection/disposal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Little Bornes, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle taking up parking space, 2nd September
item.description:
The issue has been present for over a year. The car is blocking a vital parking space. People are having to park on the pavement. Inside the car is moss and there’s just spiderwebs all over the side mirrors inside the car is one of the side mirrors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fenwick Close, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
